headline: Philip Morris International (NYSE:PM) Seeks US$1 Billion In Potential Sale Of US Cigar Business
summary: Philip Morris International (NYSE:PM) is evaluating the sale of its US cigar business, a move aligning with its major transition towards smoke-free offerings, which may have driven its shares up 20% over the last quarter. This potential divestiture shows the company's continued commitment to evolving its portfolio, resonating positively with investors, especially as broader market sentiment shows lingering economic concerns. Within the same quarter, the company's earnings report revealed a...

headline: Wall Street Lunch: Ghost Of Stagflation Alarms Investors
summary: The stagflation specter is spooking traders today, wiping out the risk-on move that was buoying stocks and weighing on board following the weekend surge in crypto.

headline: VDC Consumer Staples ETF: Good Diversifier, Buy On Weakness

headline: Philip Morris Weighs Cigar Sale Amid Smoke-Free Shift
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Philip Morris International Inc. is exploring a potential sale of its cigar business in the US, people familiar with the matter said, as the tobacco maker continues its shift toward smoke-free products. headline: Philip Morris wants to turn the page on tobacco and cigars
summary: According to Bloomberg, Philip Morris is considering spinning off its cigar business in the US, as part of its transition to smokeless products.
